Silvia Almada Monter wins Kippenhahn Prize
item.description:
The Max Planck Institute for Astrophysics (MPA) has awarded the Rudolf-Kippenhahn-Prize for the best scientific paper by a student to Silvia Almada Monter.

Silvia received the award for her paper titled “Crossing walls and windows: the curious escape of Lyman-α photons through ionized channels”. Her research challenges existing assumptions about how Lyman-alpha photons escape from galaxies, proposing a new physical picture.

The prize recognizes originality, scientific impact, and the quality of writing in publications where students made substantial contributions.

item.title: Our Group has moved to ARI/ZAH
item.description:
The ASGARD research group has officially started at the Astronomisches Rechen-Institut (ARI) at the Zentrum für Astronomie der Universität Heidelberg (ZAH).

We are excited to be part of this vibrant research environment and look forward to new collaborations and scientific discoveries.
